meanings.definition: Unable to be appeased or pacified.
meanings.sent1: The implacable teacher never accepted late homework.
meanings.sent2: Her implacable anger could not be calmed by any apology.
meanings.sent3: The implacable rain ruined our picnic plans.
meanings.sent4: His implacable determination to win the race was unmatched.
meanings.sent5: The implacable enemy army marched forward, unstoppable.

meanings.definition: Unyielding or relentless in pursuit or action.
meanings.sent1: The implacable storm raged on for days.
meanings.sent2: The detective had an implacable resolve to solve the case.
meanings.sent3: The implacable alarm clock refused to let him sleep in.
meanings.sent4: Her implacable focus on her goals led to great success.
meanings.sent5: The implacable waves crashed against the shore with force.
